intro: Argentina fallens, commonly known as the Argentine fallens, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a delicate appearance that adds to its botanical interest. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
